source.content: <doc> <foo new="true"><baz>is new</baz></foo> <foo new="true">xyz<baz>is new but has text</baz></foo> <foo new="false"><baz>is not new</baz></foo> </doc>
<doc> <foo new="true"><baz>is new</baz></foo> <foo new="true">xyz<baz>is new but has text</baz></foo> <foo new="false"><baz>is not new</baz></foo> </doc>
<!DOCTYPE t04 [ <!ELEMENT t04 (a*)> <!ELEMENT a EMPTY> <!ATTLIST a id ID #REQUIRED> ]> <t04> <a id="a"/> <a id="b"/> <a id="c"/> <a id="d"/> </t04>

test-case.name: axes-001

test-case.name: axes-044
test-case.description: Test for ancestor-or-self::*[@att1][1]/@att1 vs. (ancestor-or-self::*)[@att1][1]/@att1.

test-case.name: axes-045
test-case.description: Test for completion of tree using all axes.

test-case.description: Purpose: Test for completion of tree using all axes.

test-case.name: axes-047
test-case.description: Test for repeated use of //name (Saxon optimisation).

test-case.description: test preceding axis from an attribute. Bug report from Kurt Devlin

test-case.name: axes-049
test-case.description: test following axis from an attribute. Bug report from Kurt Devlin

test-case.name: axes-050
test-case.description: TEST namespace test on attribute axis (bug Saxon 6.2.2/002)

test-case.description: Test ancestor and ancestor-or-self axes starting at an attribute.

test-case.description: Test ancestor and ancestor-or-self axes starting at a namespace node.

test-case.description: Test following axis starting at attribute node.

test-case.description: Test ancestor axis with a specific name.

test-case.description: Test elimination of duplicates from result of path expression.

test-case.description: Test elimination of duplicates from result of path expression.

test-case.description: Test all axes with a "simple text" temporary tree.

test-case.description: Test all axes with a single-element temporary tree.

test-case.description: Test root() function.

test-case.name: axes-060
test-case.description: Test optimization of axes expressions under union, intersect, and difference .

test-case.name: axes-061
test-case.description: Test optimization of path expressions under union, intersect, and difference .

modified.change: make expected results independent of attribute order

test-case.name: axes-062
test-case.description: Test for 'ancestor::' Axis Identifier, with XPath 2.0 unordered() function

test-case.name: axes-063
test-case.description: Test for sorted results with combination of axes

test-case.name: axes-064
test-case.description: DOCUMENT: http://www.w3.org/TR/xpath SECTION: 2.2 Axes Test for generate-id() (on each tree model) The test is written to produce reproducible results

result.assert-xml: <out><v>element: a; preceding: 0</v ><v>element: x; preceding: 0</v ><v>element: b; preceding: 2</v ><v>element: x; preceding: 2</v ><v>element: c; preceding: 4</v ><v>element: x; preceding: 4</v></out>

test-case.description: test use of axes within a tree that has an element node as its root AUTHOR: Michael Kay

test-case.name: axes-083
test-case.description: Purpose: Tests apply-templates starting with a attribute axes followed by additional relative-location-path steps. Note that namespace nodes should not be included on the preceeding axis, and specifically that the implied declaration of xml: should not appear in the output. Author: Paul Dick

test-case.description: Purpose: Tests apply-templates starting with a attribute axes followed by additional relative-location-path steps. Author: Paul Dick

test-case.description: Purpose: Tests following axis starting from an attribute. Author: Scott Boag

test-case.name: axes-086
test-case.description: Purpose: Tests apply-templates starting with a attribute axis followed by additional relative-location-path steps.

test-case.name: axes-087
test-case.description: Purpose: Comprehensive test of all axes Author: Dave Haffner Special handling for attribute axis.

test-case.name: axes-088
test-case.description: Test for preceding::foo[1] vs. (preceding::foo)[1], as discussed in the first NOTE in section 3.3

test-case.name: axes-089
test-case.description: Test for preceding-sibling::foo[1] vs. (preceding-sibling::foo)[1], similar to the treatment of preceding:: in the first NOTE in section 3.3

test-case.name: axes-090
test-case.description: Test for likely optimizations of descendant patterns to make sure they're done correctly. DS meands the location path is optimizable as a single descendant iterator.

test-case.name: axes-091
test-case.description: Try 'ancestor-or-self::*' after walking down to it.

test-case.description: Purpose: Test for 'ancestor-or-self::*' Axis Identifier

test-case.description: Purpose: Test for 'ancestor::' Axis Identifier with index.

test-case.description: Purpose: Test for 'parent::' Axis Identifier using index (not that it's practical).

test-case.description: Purpose: Test for 'parent::' Axis Identifier using specified element name that is not found.

test-case.name: axes-114
test-case.description: Purpose: Test for abbreviated '..' syntax.

test-case.description: Purpose: Test for 'self::' Axis Identifier with specified element name.

test-case.description: Purpose: Test for 'self::' Axis Identifier with index (not that it's practical).

test-case.description: Purpose: Test for 'self::' Axis Identifier with specified element name that is not found.

test-case.name: axes-118
test-case.description: Purpose: Test for abbreviated '.' syntax.

test-case.name: axes-119
test-case.description: Test of //@ sequences The above two, respectively, must equal the sums of sect-*-attribs and sect-*-titles below. Rather than iterate, we want to have a sub-element name lead the path expression.

test-case.name: axes-120
test-case.description: Check that namespace nodes exist separately on each element. To suppress empty lines

test-case.name: axes-121
test-case.description: Test for '/descendant::*' to select all elements (excluding root node). No text or comments should be picked up.

result.assert-xml: <out>far-north north near-north far-west west near-west center near-south south near-south-west near-east east far-east </out>

test-case.name: axes-122
test-case.description: Test for last() on two-step paths, contrasting descendant-or-self with ancestor-or-self. Now reposition on the lowest node and look upward.

result.assert-xml:
<out>From root: 5
From doc: 5= e, a, a; 
From baz: 5= e, e, a, e, a; 
</out>

test-case.name: axes-123
test-case.description: Purpose: Tests apply-templates from an attribute using parent axis. This is a twist on axes96, where the context node is an element.

test-case.name: axes-124
test-case.description: Purpose: Tests apply-templates from a comment using parent axis. suppress whitespace-only nodes

test-case.name: axes-125
test-case.description: Ensure that preceding::node() doesn't get namespace or attribute nodes

test-case.name: axes-126
test-case.description: Ensure that preceding::node() does get comment or PI nodes

test-case.name: axes-127
test-case.description: Ensure that preceding::node() does get comment and PI nodes

test-case.name: axes-128
test-case.description: Ensure that following::node() doesn't get namespace or attribute nodes

test-case.name: axes-129
test-case.description: Check the namespace axis starting from an attribute; should be empty To suppress empty lines

modified.change: expected results should not depend on order of attributes

test-case.name: axes-130
test-case.description: Test for 'self::' axis on an attribute FALSE: principal node type of self is element FALSE: principal node type of self is element

test-case.name: axes-131
test-case.description: Test for descendant axis when siblings have some children or the context node has no siblings.

test-case.name: axes-132
test-case.description: Purpose: Test node-name function on all kinds of node (and none).

test-case.name: axes-133
test-case.description: Purpose: Traverse the ancestor::* axis Elaboration: First, jump to the center (via for-each so that we don't have interfering templates, which is less of a problem for ancestor than other axes), then apply-templates on all members of the axis under test. Also, demonstrate the statement in XSLT 5.4 that "The selected set of nodes is processed in document order, unless a sorting specification is present."

test-case.name: axes-134
test-case.description: Purpose: Test for 'attribute::*' Axis Identifier.

modified.change: make expected results independent of attribute order

test-case.name: axes-135
test-case.description: Purpose: Test for 'attribute::' Axis Identifier with index.

test-case.name: axes-136
test-case.description: Purpose: Test for 'child::*' Axis Identifier.

test-case.name: axes-137
test-case.description: Purpose: Test for 'descendant::*' Axis Identifier.

test-case.name: axes-138
test-case.description: Purpose: Test for 'descendant-or-self::*' Axis Identifier.

test-case.name: axes-139
test-case.description: Purpose: Test for 'following::*' Axis Identifier.

test-case.name: axes-140
test-case.description: Purpose: Test for 'preceding::*' Axis Identifier with wildcard.

test-case.name: axes-141
test-case.description: Purpose: Test for 'following-sibling::*' Axis Identifier.

test-case.name: axes-142
test-case.description: Purpose: Test for 'preceding-sibling::*' Axis Identifier.

test-case.name: axes-143
test-case.description: Purpose: Test for 'self::*' Axis Identifier.

test-case.name: axes-144
test-case.description: Purpose: Test for 'parent::*' Axis Identifier.

test-case.name: axes-145
test-case.description: Purpose: Test for ancestor::*[...][...] and index of ancestors.

result.assert-xml: <out>doc/foo/baz/is new doc/foo/baz/is new but has text doc/foo/baz/is not new </out>

test-case.name: axes-146
test-case.description: Purpose: Test for ancestor-or-self::*[@att1][1]/@att1 vs. (ancestor-or-self::*)[@att1][1]/@att1.

test-case.name: axes-147
test-case.description: Purpose: Test for '@*' abbreviated syntax.

modified.change: make expected results independent of attribute order

test-case.name: axes-148
test-case.description: Test for 'child::*' in match pattern.

result.assert-xml: <out>far-west west near-west center near-east east far-east </out>

test-case.name: axes-149
test-case.description: Test for 'attribute::' Axis Identifier with name of attribute.

test-case.name: axes-150
test-case.description: Test for '@' to select an attribute, with name of attribute.

test-case.name: axes-151
test-case.description: Test for '..' and an attribute of parent node.

test-case.name: axes-152
test-case.description: Test for '..//name' and an attribute.

test-case.name: axes-153
test-case.description: Test for two 'child::' Axis Identifiers in succession.

test-case.name: axes-154
test-case.description: Test for 'child::*' followed by 'descendant::*' (i.e., all grandchildren and below).

test-case.name: axes-155
test-case.description: Test for 'descendant::*' followed by 'child::*' (i.e., all grandchildren and below).

test-case.name: axes-156
test-case.description: Test for '//' followed by 'child::*' (i.e., all grandchildren).

test-case.name: axes-157
test-case.description: Section: 2.2 Purpose: Test for '//' followed by 'descendant::*' (i.e., all children and below).

test-case.name: axes-158
test-case.description: Test for named node followed by 'descendant::*' (i.e., all children and below).

test-case.name: axes-159
test-case.description: Test for named node followed by 'child::*' (i.e., all children).

test-case.name: axes-160
test-case.description: Test for '//*' (i.e., all descendants, but elements only).

test-case.name: axes-161
test-case.description: Test that combination of // and descendant specifies node can be anywhere in ancestry.

test-case.name: axes-162
test-case.description: Test that // goes down at least 15 levels.

test-case.name: axes-163
test-case.description: Check the attribute:: axis. The foo:doc selection is necessary to pick up the last doc, cuz, I change the default namespace.

modified.change: make expected results independent of attribute order

result.assert-xml: <out xmlns:foo="http://www.ped.com">x y z ay az by bz </out>

test-case.name: axes-164
test-case.description: Purpose: Step through names on the namespace axis. Ensure attributes aren't counted. To suppress empty lines

test-case.name: axes-165
test-case.description: Test for 'attribute::*' in match pattern.

modified.change: make expected results independent of attribute order

test-case.name: axes-166
test-case.description: Use a NameTest on the namespace axis. Do the same when the prefix is also declared here in the stylesheet. Shouldn't conflict.

test-case.name: axes-167
test-case.description: Test for 'self::text()' being empty when it should be

test-case.name: axes-168
test-case.description: Test for 'self::comment()' being empty when it should be

test-case.name: axes-169
test-case.description: Test for 'self::processing-instruction()' being empty when it should be

test-case.name: axes-170
test-case.description: Check that namespace axis includes all namespaces in scope.

test-case.name: axes-171
test-case.description: Compound test for preceding-sibling:: and following-sibling:: with explicit iteration.

test-case.name: axes-172
test-case.description: Compound test for preceding-sibling:: and following-sibling:: conjoined.

result.assert-xml: <out> west near-west center near-east east far-east</out>

test-case.name: axes-173
test-case.description: Compound test for preceding-sibling:: and following-sibling:: conjoined, with positional predicate on the first axis.

test-case.name: axes-174
test-case.description: Compound test for preceding-sibling:: and following-sibling:: conjoined, with positional predicates on both axes.

test-case.name: axes-175
test-case.description: Compound test where we bounce "horizontally" across the tree, using positions. Nodes in order: west, east, far-west, near-east, far-east

test-case.name: axes-176
test-case.description: Compound test for following-sibling:: and preceding-sibling:: with explicit iteration.

test-case.name: axes-177
test-case.description: Compound test for following-sibling:: and preceding-sibling:: conjoined.

result.assert-xml: <out> far-west west near-west center near-east east</out>

test-case.name: axes-178
test-case.description: Compound test for following-sibling:: and preceding-sibling:: conjoined, with positional predicate on the first axis.

test-case.name: axes-179
test-case.description: Compound test for following-sibling:: and preceding-sibling:: conjoined, with positional predicates on both axes. Reverse document order applies.

test-case.name: axes-180
test-case.description: Compound test where we bounce "horizontally" across the tree, using positions. Nodes in order: east, west, far-east, near-west, far-west

test-case.name: axes-181
test-case.description: Compound test for following::, parent, and child conjoined, with positional predicates.

test-case.name: axes-182
test-case.description: Compound test for preceding::, parent, and following:: conjoined, with positional predicates.

test-case.name: axes-183
test-case.description: Compound test for preceding::, parent, descendant::, and following-sibling:: conjoined, with positional predicates and a node test.

test-case.name: axes-184
test-case.description: Test simple notation to select entire tree.

test-case.name: axes-185
test-case.description: Compound test selecting everything that has children.

result.assert-xml: <out> far-north north near-north center near-south south</out>

test-case.name: axes-186
test-case.description: Purpose: Compound test going "vertically" in the tree. The expression selects the set of all grandparents. "//*[count(ancestor::*) >= 2]" is the set of all grandchildren.

test-case.name: axes-187
test-case.description: Alternate test to select the set of all grandparents.

test-case.name: axes-188
test-case.description: Purpose: Test to select the set of all aunts, great-aunts, etc. but exclude ancestors. "ancestor::*[count(child::*) > 1]" is the set of all ancestors with other children. MHK: the test is incorrect in using "=" to test for node identity, but never mind...

result.assert-xml: <out> north-north-west1 north-north-west2 far-west west near-west near-east east far-east north-north-east1 north-north-east2</out>

test-case.name: axes-189
test-case.description: Traverse ancestor:: starting from attributes.

test-case.name: axes-190
test-case.description: Traverse following:: starting from attributes.

result.assert-xml: <out> near-south-west near-south south far-south near-south-east near-east east far-east north-north-east1 north-north-east2</out>

test-case.name: axes-191
test-case.description: Traverse preceding:: starting from attributes.

test-case.name: axes-192
test-case.description: Test for union of preceding-sibling:: and following-sibling::

result.assert-xml: <out> far-west west near-west near-east east far-east</out>

test-case.name: axes-193
test-case.description: Test for steps beyond union of two axes.

test-case.name: axes-194
test-case.description: Test for union of two relative-location-paths

test-case.name: axes-195
test-case.description: test that adjacent text nodes are merged

test-case.name: axes-197
test-case.description: Test the id() function on a DTD-defined ID attribute

result.assert-xml: <out> Using id(): Baltimore Using idref(): [2] BravoCharlie End </out>

test-case.name: axes-202
test-case.description: Handle a comment occurring before the DOCTYPE declaration

source.content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!--A comment--> <!DOCTYPE task PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Task//EN" "axes-202.dtd"> <?Pub Inc?> <task/>
